main event: A bright light was observed in the sky over West Babylon, New York on July 16-20, 1960. The object was observed visually and by radar for about 15 minutes.
interesting points: When viewed through binoculars and a telescope, the object appeared to be rotating pendulum-like around the center and left a wake of debris that would disappear when the object was directly overhead.
The object was described as shiny, metallic, and brightly illuminated, but there was no sound associated with it.
Similar objects were reported by other witnesses in the area on the following night.
The investigators concluded that the sightings were likely caused by lightning.
The object was estimated to be about 3/10 of a mile in space and about three times smaller than a previous object reported in the media, which was said to be about 450 feet long.
sighted object: a bright, shiny, metallic object in the sky
witnesses: a local resident and their family members
